paper.title: A Temporal Analysis of Some Concurrent Systems
paper.abstract: In previous work, we presented interval temporal logic (ITL), a formal logic for reasoning about time. It was shown that ITL provides a way to view programming constructs for assignment, repetition and parallelism as logical operators. This paper demonstrates the applicability of ITL to some problems given in the STL concurrency workshop. These include a bidirectional channel, a railway and a message-routing network.
